conclusion: Analyze changes in position and size of shadows when light source moves forward.
Objects are labeled A, B, C, and D; A is a decorative item, B is a framed picture, C is a vase, D is a bottle.
Light source is above objects, casting shadows on the ground.
Shadows will shift due to light source moving forward.
Shadow of decorative item (A) will move forward.
Shadow of framed picture (B) will move forward.
Shadow of vase (C) will move forward.
Shadow of bottle (D) will move forward.
Decorative item (A) will be further to the right.
Framed picture (B) will be further to the right.
Vase (C) will be further to the right.
Bottle (D) will be further to the right.
Shadows will appear larger due to increased distance from light source.
Objects will move further to the right and shadows will appear larger.
Final answer: Objects will move further to the right, and shadows will appear larger.
